1.text: Get a flea shampoo that contains rosemary, eucalyptus, or citrus oil.

2.text: Wash your pet starting with the head and moving downwards.

3.text: Apply an apple cider vinegar spray to your pet for a natural flea preventative.

4.text: Try brushing your pet with lemon juice for another natural preventative.

5.text: Apply an over-the-counter or prescription product for maximum effectiveness.

6.text: Wash all of your bedding to kill any fleas on it.

7.text: Vacuum all of the floors in your home to remove any fleas and eggs.

8.text: Sprinkle diatomaceous earth on infested surfaces for a natural flea-killer.

9.text: Try spraying an insecticide throughout your home if the problem persists.

10.text: Continue to treat your home for several weeks until the fleas subside.

11.text: Focus on treating shaded areas of your yard that your pet frequents.

12.text: Remove any debris in your yard that could trap moisture and provide shade.

13.text: Spray your yard with an insecticide to kill any fleas in it.

14.text: Call a professional exterminator if you want help applying an insecticide.

15.text: Use cedar chips in your yard to help prevent fleas from coming back.
